intro: Tripterospermum volubile subsp. longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed star vine, is a climbing shrub native to southern South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, elliptic leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers arranged in clusters, followed by red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for birds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in temperate rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
